snippet.textDisplay: Exactly where he said. The song even starts exactly like Polyanna and starts as you leave your home, just like the first Mother. snippet.textDisplay: This is an RPG I've wanted to play for years. No really, since I was 11 years old I've wanted this game. On an ACTUAL SNES that is. I much prefer an actual system to an emulator. The only game I would ever use an emulator for is Mother 3, and I don't plan on playing Mother 3 until I play Earthbound. Too bad copies of this game go for 100$ at their lowest on the internet.
snippet.textOriginal: This is an RPG I've wanted to play for years. No really, since I was 11 years old I've wanted this game. On an ACTUAL SNES that is. I much prefer an actual system to an emulator. The only game I would ever use an emulator for is Mother 3, and I don't plan on playing Mother 3 until I play Earthbound. Too bad copies of this game go for 100$ at their lowest on the internet.

snippet.textDisplay: Brings me back. I DID grow up on these games. You are so right, games today don't can't compare to the SNES days. I miss the Final Fantasy series being good. I know there will never be another epic one ever again. I still own my massive SNES RPG collection and I don't care if it ends up being worth $1,000,000 someday, I'll never get rid of it :)

snippet.textDisplay: I actually bought this and played it on the SNES a few months ago because I thought I owed it to myself to experience all of the best games this world has to offer. Let me tell ya this game was something else. The battle system was kind of weak, but just the way the game played out was something I can't put my finger on. Nor can I explain it. Not to mention this town music was stuck in my head for days.

snippet.textDisplay: I love this theme, because it takes a weird and strange approach to making a song, sounding pretty dissonant, but it still manages to be a good song. Like the entire game: Weird and seemingly unplanned, but really good.

snippet.textDisplay:
@SupraDarky 
No kidding, I missed my opportunity to play it on SNES but I was able to play it on a modded PS2 with a game disc that ran SNES Station. It tricked our PS2 into thinking it was a SNES, which was awesome! I completely agree with you, it had an immense impact on me when I was 16 years old.  I would just sit in Onett and listen to the music just for fun.
snippet.textOriginal:
@SupraDarky 
No kidding, I missed my opportunity to play it on SNES but I was able to play it on a modded PS2 with a game disc that ran SNES Station. It tricked our PS2 into thinking it was a SNES, which was awesome! I completely agree with you, it had an immense impact on me when I was 16 years old.  I would just sit in Onett and listen to the music just for fun.

snippet.textDisplay: I have to admit, I'm 14 years old at the moment (This is actually my mothers account, but she never uses it). I'm sad I didn't grow up with these games. I play SNES days almost all the time, and I find them infinitely better than all the shite that is being realesed these days. I mean, compare the SNES FF's with today's, just as an example. And of course, the Earthbound series is probably the best three turn based RPG's there are. Just stating a fact there.

If you guys like old school games like this, you should check out my very own RPG game called Pure RPG. Trailer video can be found on my channel, so click my name to watch. If you like, visit my website and try the free demo or buy the full game, it's only $10! :)

snippet.textDisplay: I am very grateful I even got the chance to purchase Earthbound.  I got it last year for $70 with a copy of Chrono Trigger on the SNES for $55.  Add tax and I paid $140 for two games.  This hurt my tuition at school.  The cost felt horrid at first, as I didn't enjoy being beaten up by the sharks and Peaceful Rest Valley, but the second playthrough sealed the deal.
snippet.textOriginal: I am very grateful I even got the chance to purchase Earthbound.  I got it last year for $70 with a copy of Chrono Trigger on the SNES for $55.  Add tax and I paid $140 for two games.  This hurt my tuition at school.  The cost felt horrid at first, as I didn't enjoy being beaten up by the sharks and Peaceful Rest Valley, but the second playthrough sealed the deal.

snippet.textDisplay: EarthBound for the win

snippet.textDisplay: Onett's theme could easily be part of my Best VGM x00 videos as it's the song you hear when you start your adventure and this game being one of my favorites. It really had a big impact on my 10 year old self.
